First off Reform Cards only show 1-3 recent games as example of the kind of problematic behavior that got you punished, and it does not mean they were the only ones that were problematic.

Second off "They started it/were worse" doesn't work here as everyone is responsible for their own behavior. 

Third off talking too much by itself is not the issue (unless you're just spamming but that's beside the point), it's the content behind it that is. You could type 10 lines or 100 lines, but if all or the majority of your chat is dedicated to harassing or flaming someone, egging them on or just in general being a royal pain/nuisance then you're gonna get punished for that.

Heck you even admit that you went overboard in the first game. While the second game is relatively tame, the first game is definitely the most problematic (again by your own admission), as you spend the vast majority of it egging people on, being passive-aggressive, calling for reports (only one is needed) and just in general being a royal pain and an unpleasant nuisance to deal with. Anything positive or helpful just gets lost in the sea of negativity.

In the future if someone is acting up in chat then just mute them, and if they're acting up by trolling or whatever then just do your best to play around them until the game is over. Regardless don't spend the whole game complaining or harassing them about it or trying to bait them into acting up more as trolls love that (the negative reactions I mean). If you ignore them then chances are they'll shape up on their own since no ones responding to their antics (no audience=no motive) and you don't risk falling with them.

There are many examples in the Player Behavior boards alone of people getting straight-up banned for telling others to kill themselves or generally saying things they should know they shouldn't be saying.
 
> I understand the he started it bullshit isn't a valid defense however he didn't start an argument, he started me trying to teach him the weight of what he had said. 
 
> People get clearly bullied online and this system allows people to be bullied, get reported and then get punished. Chat log 2 is the best example they could find of me being toxic because I'm rarely a problem.... This was a one time thing that was set off by someone telling me to kill myself. 

People only get punished for chat if they're consistently causing problems in it across multiple games. The IFS may have built-in leniency for the occasional off game or two but it's not indefinite. Consistency X Severity is how the IFS handles handing out punishments, meaning that even offenses that are pretty small and minor can add up over time.

Think of it like a cop pulling you over for speeding and then giving you a speeding ticket after finding out you've been warned before not to, or how they arrest you after finding out you've had multiple speeding violations recently.

If people would just learn to put their egos and pride aside and actually mute the people acting up in chat rather than argue with them and give them the negative reaction they want then there'd likely be less complaints about it.
 
> Another thing about chat log 2 is the guy in the freaking game being toxic that I'm responding to sarcastically kind of making fun of the fact he was blaming me in a blow out loss... HE IS THE GUY THAT REPORTED ME?!

At the end of the day it's just a chat restriction-a slap on the wrist/ticket meant to have you take a look at how your behaving and look at adjusting it so you don't get in trouble again in the future-that's all.
